com.rental.web.controller

Class RentalController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rental.web.controller.RentalController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/v1/rental")
public class RentalController
extends java.lang.Object

    Controller class to handle rental request. A rental object will be passed by various methods with the option to have unregistered users get a quote for a rental.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RentalController(RentalService rentalService) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      PUT method for the quote on renting bicycles for a specific time and for a specific amount of bikes.

    • Method Detail

      • createRental

        @RequestMapping(value="{userId}",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<RentalResource> createRental(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                             java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                                                                                             @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                             RentalResource rentalResource)

        POST method to create a new rental request for a user.

        Parameters:
        userId - representing the user id of the user requesting to rent the bicycles.
        rentalResource - representing the newly rented bike information the customer wants.
        Returns:
        RentalResource with the complete information wrapped in response entity with the appropriate HTTP code.
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistsException - if the user has not been created
        InvalidDateException - if the date for the request if prior than today date.

      • getAllRentals

        @RequestMapping(method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<RentalListResource> getAllRentals()

        GET method to retrieve all existing rental requests.

        Returns:
        List of RentalResources with all existing rentals with the appropriate HTTP code. If no rental are created the response code will be NOT_FOUND.

      • getRentalPricing

        @RequestMapping(method=PUT)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<RentalResource> getRentalPricing(@RequestBody
                                                                                                             RentalResource rentalResource)

        PUT method for the quote on renting bicycles for a specific time and for a specific amount of bikes.

        Parameters:
        rentalResource - That will have the amount of hours and the amount of bicycles requested.
        Returns:
        RentalResource with the appropriate HTTP code and the price for the requested quote.

      • removeRental

        @RequestMapping(value="{rentalId}",
                method=DELETE)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<RentalResource> removeRental(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.Long rentalId)

        DELETE method to remove a previously booked rental.

        Parameters:
        rentalId - for the rental option that the customer wants to cancel.
        Returns:
        RentalResource for the deleted rental option, if none was found the http status will be NOT_FOUND. Otherwise the appropriate HTTP code will be returned.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the request rental does not exist.
